We wrote this for ourown testing purposes at https://www.hvst.com. Thanks`brenguyen711 <https://github.com/brenguyen711>`__ for the great name!Install-------:: sudo pip install boddleUsage-----Assuming you have a bottle route like this:.. code:: python @bottle.get('/woot') def woot(): return bottle.request.params['name']You can unit test it like:.. code:: python import unittest from boddle import boddle class TestIt(unittest.TestCase): def testWoot(self): with boddle(params={'name':'derek'}): self.assertEqual(woot(), 'derek')See ```example.py`` <example.py>`__.Options~~~~~~~The Bottle-specific params that are supported are:+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| Argument | Notes |+=========================================+============================+| ``params`` | Populates || | ``request.params``. Takes || | a ``dict`` or list of || | pairs. Useful for both || | POST and GET params. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| ``path`` | The path component of the || | url. Populates || | ``request.path``, which || | always has a preceeding || | ``/``. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| ``method`` | POST, GET, etc. Bottle || | will uppercase the value. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| ``headers`` | Any HTTP headers. Takes a || | ``dict``. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| ``json`` | Takes anything that can be || | consumed by || | ``json.dumps()``. Also || | sets the content type of || | the request. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| ``url`` | The full URL, protocol, || | domain, port, path, etc. || | Will be parsed until its || | ``urlparts`` before || | populating || | ``request.url``. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| ``body`` | The raw body of the || | request. Takes either a || | ``str`` or a file-like || | object. ``str``\ s will be || | converted into file-like || | objects. Populated || | ``request.body``. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+| ``query`` | Populates || | ``request.query``. Takes a || | ``dict``. |+-----------------------------------------+----------------------------+All other keyword arguments will be assigned to the request object. Forinstance, we often do:.. code:: python with boddle(current_user=someone): # code that accesses bottle.request.current_userYou can also nest ``boddle`` calls. For instance:.. code:: python with boddle(path='/woot'): with boddle(params={'name':'derek'}): # both path and params are set here # only path is set here**ALL CHANGES TO ``bottle.request`` ARE REVERTED WHEN THE WITH BLOCKENDS.**Testing-------.. figure:: https://api.travis-ci.org/keredson/boddle.svg?branch=master :alt: image image:: $ git clone https://github.com/keredson/boddle.git $ cd boddle $ python tests.py ............ ---------------------------------------------------------------------- Ran 12 tests in 0.001s OK
